business.headline: Gold at record high: Why Indians are choosing coins and ETFs over jewelleryGold prices in India have surged to historic highs in 2025, leading many consumers to shift from traditional jewellery purchases to coins, bars, and other investment forms, says report.

Swiggy, Zomato raise delivery incentive amid gig worker strike: ReportThe rise in incentives comes ahead of New Year's Eve, one of the busiest days for food delivery and online orders, when worker unions have called for fresh protests.

From Reliance Jio, PhonePe to Zepto: 5 key IPOs to watch in 2026India's IPO pipeline for 2026 is packed with some of the country's most talked-about companies. From established giants like Reliance Jio to fast-growing startups such as Zepto, several big listings are expected to keep investors busy.

How India overtook China to become the world's top rice producerIndia has emerged as the world's largest rice producer, but closing the yield gap and managing water stress will decide whether this production surge becomes a lasting advantage.

Hindustan copper share price tanks 3%: What's behind the fall?Copper prices have risen sharply this year due to supply disruptions at key global mines and strong demand from sectors such as electrification, renewable energy and artificial intelligence-led infrastructure.
Sensex opens 227 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 185.43 points to 84,860.51, while the NSE Nifty50 added 76.75 points to 26,015.60 as of 9:29 am.

Gold set for 50-year best, silver breaks records: Where should money go in 2026?After months of sharp gains, some investors are locking in profits, leading to short-term weakness in gold and silver. Even so, prices remain far higher than where they began the year.

Swiggy, Zomato, other gig delivery workers on New Year's Eve strike: Key demandsWorkers had already held a nationwide flash strike on December 25, which led to a 50–60% disruption in services in several cities.

Disney to pay $10m to settle children's privacy violations on YouTubeRegulators alleged that Disney failed to identify certain videos as being directed at children, despite the content being clearly child-focused. As a result, children were allegedly served targeted advertisements and had their personal information collected without proper notice to or consent from parents.

India imposes 3-year steel tariffs, targets cheap China importsIndia has imposed higher import duties on select steel products after trade regulators flagged a sharp rise in low-priced imports hurting domestic steelmakers.

India becomes 4th-largest economy by overtaking Japan, set to pip Germany by 2030India's real GDP grew 8.2 per cent in Q2 of 2025-26, driven by strong domestic consumption, urban demand, and structural reforms, the Centre said.

Why treating bonuses as permanent income can backfire on your financesMany people see bonuses as extra money and quickly adjust their spending or investments. But treating variable income as permanent can quietly strain finances and create stress later, even when salaries remain unchanged.

China asks chipmakers to use at least 50% local equipment: ReportLarge public investments are supporting this push. Through the government-backed "Big Fund", China has poured hundreds of billions of yuan into the sector, including a major new funding phase launched in 2024.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower as FII outflows weigh on investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 20.46 points to close at 84,675.08, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by just 3.25 points to end at 25,938.85.

Home buying with purpose: Simple steps to turn property into wealthAcross metro cities and several tier-2 cities, residential prices have moved up steadily over the last decade. Land prices have increased, construction costs are higher, and most new housing supply is coming in the mid to premium segments.

These Indian billionaires added the most wealth in 2025According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, Mukesh Ambani was the biggest wealth gainer among Indian billionaires in 2025. Ambani added $16.50 billion to his net worth during the year.

New Year 2026: 5 easy personal finance tips for better money controlWith rising costs and busy lives, managing money can feel overwhelming. As 2026 begins, these easy personal finance tips can help you stay organised and confident about your money.

Last date for revised ITR is tomorrow, December 31: Will the deadline be extended?There is only one day left to file a revised ITR for the current assessment year. With growing pressure on taxpayers and professionals, many are now wondering whether the Income Tax Department will extend the revised ITR deadline.

BNW unveils Tonino Lamborghini Residences in Ras Al KhaimahBNW Developments introduced the first Tonino Lamborghini Residences in Ras Al Khaimah with a launch attended by celebrities and industry stakeholders.

Only 1 day left for PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline: Are you legally exempt?With December 31 just a day away, taxpayers are running out of time to link PAN with Aadhaar. For most people, the process is mandatory, but some individuals are legally exempt from this requirement.

entertainment.headline: Bad Boy Billionaires India: Final episode on Satyam scandal releases after 5 years The much-awaited fourth episode of Bad Boy Billionaires: India, focusing on the Satyam Computer Services scandal, has been released on Netflix after a five-year legal battle, concluding the investigative series.

Chappell Roan backtracks on Brigitte Bardot praise after knowing of far-right views Singer Chappell Roan has retracted her public praise of Brigitte Bardot after learning of the late French actor's far-right political views and history of convictions for inciting racial hatred.

Deepika Padukone lives pop dream at Backstreet Boys' concert with best friend Deepika Padukone attended a Backstreet Boys concert in Las Vegas with her friend Sneha Ramchander as part of her New Year celebrations. She and husband Ranveer Singh are spending time with their family in the United States.

Bharti Singh debunks AI images of newborn son Kaju, confirms face not revealed Comedian Bharti Singh has clarified that recent images of her son Kaju, circulating on social media, are not authentic. Bharti and her husband, Haarsh Limbachiyaa, are yet to reveal their son's face publicly.

Nayanthara wields gun in stylish first-look poster of Yash's Toxic With the release drawing closer, the makers of Yash's Toxic have unveiled the first look poster of Nayanthara as Ganga in the Geetu Mohandas directorial.

Theertharoopa Thandeyavarige review: A truly emotional and engaging family dramaRelease Date:Thu Jan 01, 2026 Theertharoopa Thandeyavarige film review: Directed by Ramenahalli Jagannatha of Hondisi Bareyiri fame, this family drama is a heart-warming tale of mending hearts.

New man in Jiya Shankar's life? Actor dismisses link-up with Fukra Insaan Actor Jiya Shankar has denied speculation about her engagement to influencer Fukra Insaan, also known as Abhishek Malhan. The clarification came after rumours suggested that the duo are set to get engaged soon.

Why Varun Dhawan was dropped from Ikkis? Director Sriram Raghavan answers Sriram Raghavan explains the decision to cast Agastya Nanda instead of Varun Dhawan in Ikkis. He focused on the importance of age to portray Arun Khetarpal's story authentically.

Mari Selvaraj on unsettling impact of Homebound: It left me disturbed for 2-3 days Director Mari Selvaraj reflected on the impact of the film Homebound, sharing how its raw depiction of oppression left him disturbed for several days and inspired thoughts on creating more authentic cinema.

Ikkis director Sriram Raghavan admires Aditya Dhar but won't make a Dhurandhar Ikkis director Sriram Raghavan says he likes Aditya Dhar's style of storytelling and is glad about Dhurandhar's success, but he would never make a film like that following the same pattern.

Aamir Khan and R Madhavan dismiss 3 Idiots sequel rumours: Sounds far-fetched Amid renewed buzz about a sequel to 3 Idiots, Aamir Khan and R Madhavan have clarified that no official plans are underway. Sharman Joshi, too, earlier reacted to the speculation.

Agastya Nanda's Ikkis performance moves Arun Khetarpal's brother. Watch At a recent special screening in Mumbai, Mukesh Khetarpal, brother of war hero Arun Khetarpal, expressed deep emotion and appreciation for Agastya Nanda's portrayal in Sriram Raghavan's upcoming film 'Ikkis'.

KBC 17 grand finale sees Amitabh Bachchan sing classics non-stop for 32 minutes Amitabh Bachchan, at age 83, sang non-stop for over 32 minutes during the season finale of Kaun Banega Crorepati 17. He performed his all-time hit songs, lifting the spirits of the studio audience.

Jana Nayagan audio launch to be out on TV and OTT: When and where to watch The audio launch event for Thalapathy Vijay's upcoming film Jana Nayagan, recently held in Malaysia as a tribute to the actor's career, will be available for streaming on OTT and television on January 4.

Why Mohanlal was South cinema's star of the year Mohanlal dominated South cinema in 2025 with multiple blockbuster hits and bold genre experiments. His success revived Malayalam cinema's fortunes despite sparking industry debates.

Tu Meri Main Tera box office Day 6: Kartik film sees drop amid Dhurandhar storm The romantic comedy 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' has experienced a notable decrease in box office earnings after its initial release amid the 'Dhurandhar' release. The film's performance highlights challenges in sustaining momentum against established competitors.

Once again Nick Jonas turns DJ, vibes to Priyanka's Mujhse Shaadi Karogi. Watch Nick Jonas' upbeat dance to Priyanka Chopra's iconic Bollywood track with the Jonas Brothers has captured attention online. In his latest clip, the singer-actor could be seen grooving to Mujhse Shaadi Karogi.

AP Dhillon concert row: Orry defends Tara, Veer with unedited clip Orry posted behind-the-scenes concert footage as speculation mounted over Veer Pahariya's reaction to Tara Sutaria and AP Dhillon's onstage moment. The clip contrasts with earlier clips that went viral.

Dhurandhar box office Day 26: Ranveer Singh's film roars at Rs 1,095 crore worldwide Director Aditya Dhar's spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' experienced significant growth at the box office, with collections rising during the New Year's Eve period. The film, starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, is breaking records in both domestic and overseas markets.

general news.headline: No third party: India's firm reply as China joins Trump in Pak truce credit warIndia has consistently maintained that the ceasefire on May 10, following Operation Sindoor, was reached following direct talks between New Delhi and Islamabad.

Swiggy, Zomato, other gig delivery workers on New Year's Eve strike: Key demandsWorkers had already held a nationwide flash strike on December 25, which led to a 50–60% disruption in services in several cities.

Packed with pig poop goodness: People mock Bangladesh on US corn importsPig manure is commonly used as a fertiliser in corn cultivation in the United States. The issue has gained traction and generated buzz because Bangladesh is a Muslim-majority country, where the use and consumption of pork-related products are considered haram.

Woman offered lift, raped for hours in moving van, dumped on roadside in FaridabadA woman in Faridabad faced a horrific ordeal when she was allegedly raped inside a moving van after accepting a late-night lift. Police have registered a case and are actively searching for the accused.

The Wuhan alert that changed the world on this day six years agoHealth authorities in Wuhan, China, issued an urgent alert reporting cases of an unidentified pneumonia. It initially went unnoticed. Then it crossed border, continents, oceans.

Live: Huge crowd gathers near Dhaka Parliament for Khaleda Zia's funeral prayerKhaleda Zia Last Rites Live Updates: The death of former Bangladesh Prime Minister and BNP chairperson Khaleda Zia has triggered nationwide mourning and wide international reactions. As tributes pour in from political leaders in Bangladesh, India and beyond, her life story has also drawn attention to her roots in Jalpaiguri, West Bengal, and her family's migration to East Pakistan after Partition. Khaleda Zia, a dominant figure in Bangladesh's politics and the country's first woman prime minister, is remembered as a resilient leader who shaped the nation's democratic journey amid prolonged political struggle. Her funeral will be held in Dhaka amid tight security, with several foreign dignitaries, including India's External Affairs Minister, expected to attend. Stay with IndiaToday.com for live updates-

How India overtook China to become the world's top rice producerIndia has emerged as the world's largest rice producer, but closing the yield gap and managing water stress will decide whether this production surge becomes a lasting advantage.

The Turning of the Wheel: A History of New Year  For several millennia, humans followed nature's rhythms and the sun's path to calculate the beginning of a new year. Then one day a Roman emperor decreed that the new year should begin as an ode to Janus.

Women feel betrayed, desert Bangladesh's NCP. Did they ignore Jamaat DNA?Several prominent women leaders of the NCP, the Bangladesh students' party backing the Muhammad Yunus-led interim set-up, have either spoken against the outfit or resigned in the last one week. Behind the anger is the NCP's alliance with the radical Jamaat-e-Islami. Did they overlook the Jamaat DNA?

Bengaluru man, 26, dies after jumping from Biocon office's 5th floorA 26-year-old employee of Biocon Biologics died by suicide after jumping from the fifth floor of his office building in Bengaluru on Tuesday.

Contaminated municipal pipeline water kills 7 in Indore, over 100 hospitalisedWhile the water sample test reports are awaited, the Indore Mayor pointed out that at first glance it appeared that drainage water might have gotten mixed with drinking water supply lines, contaminating the water.

Doctor in Nitish Kumar hijab row yet to join duty, deadline lapses todayThe controversy over Ayush doctor Nusrat Parveen's veil removal by Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has kept the spotlight on her pending joining at a government health centre. Despite the deadline ending today, she has not reported for duty, raising questions about her future in government service.

These are our favourite sporting moments of 2025. What is yours?Records fell, waits ended and futures arrived early in 2025, a year when sport refused to slow down, and left us all with moments worth arguing about long after the final whistle. Which moment gave you goosebumps, joy or disbelief? Tell us the one you'll never forget.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

Natti chicken feast planned as Siddaramaiah closes in on record Karnataka CM tenureWith a week to go, Siddaramaiah is poised to break Devaraj Urs's record and cement his legacy as Karnataka's longest-serving chief minister.

India becomes 4th-largest economy by overtaking Japan, set to pip Germany by 2030India's real GDP grew 8.2 per cent in Q2 of 2025-26, driven by strong domestic consumption, urban demand, and structural reforms, the Centre said.

Why Mohanlal was South cinema's star of the yearMohanlal dominated South cinema in 2025 with multiple blockbuster hits and bold genre experiments. His success revived Malayalam cinema's fortunes despite sparking industry debates.

How Nasa brought Mars closer to Earth in 2025Nasa has transformed Mars exploration in 2025 through the Perseverance rover, ESCAPADE twin-spacecraft, and groundbreaking laser communications. These missions have successfully bridged the gap between Earth and the Red Planet like never before.

'Al-Qaeda lawyer, anti-Israel': Zohran Mamdani's legal advisor pick ignites fireNew York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani appoints Ramzi Kassem as chief legal counsel. The decision has sparked strong conservative backlash over Kassem's past defence of an al-Qaeda associate and polarising activism.

Gold set for 50-year best, silver breaks records: Where should money go in 2026?After months of sharp gains, some investors are locking in profits, leading to short-term weakness in gold and silver. Even so, prices remain far higher than where they began the year.

Peanuts, Doordarshan and gajar ka halwa: A 90s New Year we didn't know was specialNew Year's Eve in 90s India was a quiet celebration centred around Doordarshan and homemade snacks. This nostalgic tradition highlights simpler times before digital distractions and lavish parties.

Explained: Akshaye Khanna's Drishyam 3 exit and the storm after Dhurandhar successAkshaye Khanna's exit from Drishyam 3 has sparked industry outrage, legal threats and debate -- raising questions about silence, stardom and the timing of making choices in Bollywood.

New Year in a haze as fog blinds Delhi-NCR; flight ops hit, AQI still very poorDense fog in Delhi-NCR caused flight delays and cancellations early on Wednesday. The persistent fog worsened already toxic air just hours before the New Year, though the weather department has forecast light rain.

From Reliance Jio, PhonePe to Zepto: 5 key IPOs to watch in 2026India's IPO pipeline for 2026 is packed with some of the country's most talked-about companies. From established giants like Reliance Jio to fast-growing startups such as Zepto, several big listings are expected to keep investors busy.

sports.headline: England to win next Ashes in Australia: Former cricketer makes bizarre prediction Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell has made a bold prediction regarding England's Ashes prospects in Australia. The former spinner has backed the English side to end their Ashes series victory down under in their next series in the country.

Cricket fraternity rallies around Damien Martyn as serious illness leaves him in coma Adam Gilchrist, R Ashwin and VVS Laxman were among the cricketers who sent messages of support to Damien Martyn after the former Australia batter was hospitalised with meningitis. Messages from across the cricketing world followed as former teammates, opponents, and current players wished Martyn strength and a speedy recovery while he remains under medical care.

These are our favourite sporting moments of 2025. What is yours? Records fell, waits ended and futures arrived early in 2025, a year when sport refused to slow down, and left us all with moments worth arguing about long after the final whistle. Which moment gave you goosebumps, joy or disbelief? Tell us the one you'll never forget.

After World Cup snub, Gill to play Vijay Hazare Trophy in January: Report Shubman Gill, Ravindra Jadeja and KL Rahul will play in the Vijay Hazare Trophy in January. The trio will leave their respective teams ahead of the three-match ODI series against New Zealand, beginning on January 11.

Arsenal end 2025 on top, Man United stumble against bottom-placed Wolves Premier League 2025-26: Arsenal delivered a commanding 4-1 win against Aston Villa to end 2025 at the top of the table. Meanwhile, Manchester United struggled to a 1-1 draw with bottom-placed Wolves on Tuesday night.

Ashes hero Travis Head makes crucial BBL call ahead of T20 World Cup Travis Head, who has played a key role in Australia's Ashes dominance, is likely to sit out of the Big Bash League season. The left-handed opener said he is focussing on remaining fresh for T20 World Cup, starting February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

Damien Martyn in induced coma, battling for life against Meningitis Former Australian cricketer Damien Martyn is in an induced coma fighting meningitis. His condition has drawn widespread concern and prayers from the cricket community across Australia.

Indian sports in 2025: Handshake rows, stampedes and controversies that shaped the year From league uncertainty and safety scares to stampedes, political snubs and war halting the IPL, Indian sport in 2025 was defined by chaos, controversy and failures that overshadowed competition.

Carlsen now a 20-time world champion, ends 2025 with Rapid and Blitz double Magnus Carlsen extended his dominance by winning a record ninth World Blitz title along with the Rapid gold medal in Doha. Carlsen defeated Uzbek GM Nodirbek Abdusattorov after producing a stunning, unexpected pawn move in the fourth game of the clash to seal a 2.5–1.5 victory.

Margins to mainstream: India women's cricket team wins Battle of the Sexes in 2025 2025 was the year Indian women's cricket earned the respect it deserved, with India lifting their maiden ICC title — the ODI World Cup. The challenge for India in the coming year will be to maintain that consistency and, perhaps, add a T20 World Cup title at Lord's to their growing legacy.

Jemimah selfie, debutants lifting trophy: India sign off in style after Sri Lanka sweep Jemimah Rodrigues took her signature selfie and the debutants Kamalini and Vaishanavi Sharma lifted the trophy for the side as India celebrated their 5-0 series win over Sri Lanka in style on Tuesday, December 30.

Carlsen reaches World blitz C'ships final after turnaround, Erigaisi gets bronzeArjun Erigaisi's remarkable World Blitz campaign ended with a semifinal loss to Nodirbek Abdusattorov, earning the Indian Grandmaster a historic double bronze. Magnus Carlsen set up a final showdown with Abdusattorov after overcoming Fabiano Caruana.

5th WT20I: India thump Sri Lanka to complete 5-0 clean sweep, ends 2025 with a bangWith the final game of the series, Sri Lanka finally decided to wake up and put up their best performance in the series. But India proved to be too good for them as they went on to take the win by XX runs to complete the 5-0 series whitewash in Thiruvananthapuram on Tuesday, December 30.

BBL: Taxi breaks down, Perth Scorchers players arrive at stadium by pushing UberBBL: Hilarious scenes unfolded on Tuesday after some of the Perth Scorchers players got stuck on their way to the stadium. While travelling to the stadium, their Uber broke down, but they managed to revive the situation.

Watch: Glenn Phillips turns left hander, stuns fans with mega sixesNew Zealand batter Glenn Phillips stunned the crowd by turning into a left-hander. Playing in the Super Smash, Phillips slam-banged his way to an unbeaten 90 runs off just 48 balls.

How Usman Khawaja should retire after 5th Ashes Test? Ex-Australia captain reveals planMichael Clarke has tipped Usman Khawaja to retire from cricket after the SCG Test. Clarke is hoping that Khawaja can sign off on a high by scoring a hundred in front of his home crowd in Sydney.

Watch: Magnus loses cool again, board fumble leads to defeat at World Blitz C'shipMagnus Carlsen suffered a bizarre loss at the World Blitz Championship after fumbling his pieces with seconds left, leading to defeat against Haik Martirosyan in Doha.

IND vs SL: Smriti Mandhana rested for final T20I, India hand G Kamalini debutIndia have decided to rest Smriti Mandhana for the final T20I of the series against Sri Lanka. They have handed the young prodigy G Kamalini her debut for the match in Trivandrum.

Lasith Malinga joins Sri Lanka's coaching staff ahead of T20 World Cup 2026Lasith Malinga has been appointed Sri Lanka's fast-bowling consultant as part of their preparations for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, bringing vast white-ball and coaching experience to the setup.

5th Women's T20I Highlights: India complete 5-0 sweep with 15-run winIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women Highlights: A commanding performance from the bowlers and a brilliant fifty from Harmanpreet Kaur was enough as India complete the 5-0 sweep over Sri Lanka to head into the new year with a big win.

Suryakumar Yadav used to message me a lot: Actor makes explosive claimActor Khushi Mukherjee has gone viral on social media after making a bombshell claim involving the India T20I captain. Mukherjee has claimed that Suryakumar Yadav used to message her frequently in the past. However, she has denied any romantic involvement with a cricketer.

T20 World Cup 2026: Oman name Jatinder Singh as captain, leave out veteran KaleemOman's most experienced player, Jatinder Singh, will captain the national team at the 2026 ICC Men's T20 World Cup after missing the previous edition. The squad features five changes from the Asia Cup, with veteran Aamir Kaleem omitted despite recent strong performances.

Australia, England are disregarding Ashes, disrespecting Test cricket: ChappellAshes: Legendary Greg Chappell has lashed out at the Australia and England teams after the Boxing Day Test match failed to last two days. In a scathing column, Chappell has written that both teams are disrespecting the legacy of Test cricket.

Ellyse Perry withdraws from WPL 2026 in big blow for Royal Challengers BengaluruEllyse Perry has withdrawn from the Women's Premier League 2026 due to personal reasons, with Sayali Satghare named as her replacement. USA pacer Tara Norris and Australian all-rounder Annabel Sutherland have also pulled out of the tournament.

Shaheen Shah Afridi returns home from BBL with knee injury ahead of T20 World CupPakistan's Shaheen Shah Afridi will return home from the Big Bash League after suffering a knee cartilage injury while fielding for Brisbane Heat.

ICC agrees with Gautam Gambhir's assessment, spares Kolkata pitch a poor ratingThe ICC rated the Eden Gardens pitch as 'satisfactory' despite criticism following India's Test defeat to South Africa. The decision contrasted with the Melbourne Cricket Ground receiving an 'unsatisfactory' rating, underlining differing pitch standards in international cricket.

Indian Olympic Association to host first athlete-led forum in Ahmedabad on Jan 10The Indian Olympic Association will convene its inaugural National Athletes' Forum on 10 January in Ahmedabad. The event aims to give athletes a direct role in shaping sports governance, with a focus on athlete rights, welfare, and policy reform.

Sensational Amelia Kerr warms up for WPL 2026 with maiden T20 centuryMumbai Indians' Amelia Kerr warmed up for WPL 2026 in emphatic fashion, smashing her maiden T20 century to lead Wellington to a 49-run win against Auckland and underline her all-round value ahead of the season.

Ashes: England players cleared as investigation into excessive drinking row endsAccording to a report from the Daily Mail, the England players have been given a clean chit as the investigation into the excessive drinking row has come to an end.

Pakistan hockey players threaten FIH Pro League boycott as pay dispute continuesSenior Pakistan hockey players have threatened to boycott the upcoming fixtures in Australia, citing significant discrepancies in daily allowances paid for the recent Argentina leg of the FIH Pro League. The dispute centers on a gap between the amount promised and the amount received, with federation and board officials citing conflicting policies and funding restrictions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
